title: Cyclone Chido wreaks havoc on Mayotte: 'It's carnage!'
summary: Wind gusts of over 220 km/h were recorded on the archipelago on Saturday morning. At least two people died but the death toll could be much higher, as several shanty towns were blown away.

title: How Bayrou, France's new PM, forced Macron to yield
summary: Eager to regain control, the French president was about to appoint the outgoing armed forces minister as prime minister. But under the threat of losing his ally François Bayrou, Emmanuel Macron finally gave in.

title: François Euvé, theologian: 'Pope Francis' visit to Corsica is emblematic of a pontificate marked by sideways steps'
summary: The Jesuit journalist and writer analyzes the reasons why Pope Francis has chosen to visit Ajaccio (Corsica) on Sunday, for a symposium on popular religion, rather than Paris for the reopening of Notre-Dame.

title: Kirill Serebrennikov, filmmaker: 'War has killed freedom and culture in Russia'
summary: Since 2022, the Russian director has been living between France and Germany in the hopes of building bridges between members of his country's intelligentsia who, like him, are in exile.

title: Saudi-hosted COP16 ends without reaching agreement to combat drought
summary: For two weeks, the risks to food supply were at the heart of debates at the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification, which failed to achieve the drought protocol called for by Africa.

title: A surprise surge of adult baptisms in France, despite the Catholic Church's decline
summary: In 2024, France's Catholic church recorded a 31% increase in adult baptisms over the previous year. A quest for meaning or a return to tradition? A number of factors explain the rise, which should continue in 2025.

title: Trump names loyalist Truth Social CEO to lead intelligence advisory board
summary: Devin Nunes, former congressman, has accused the Federal Bureau of Investigation of abusing its powers to spy on a Trump election campaign official who had extensive Russian contacts.

title: Ukraine's search for children it says have been deported, indoctrinated and 'Russified' by Moscow
summary: Of the 20,000 Ukrainian children identified by Kyiv as being cases of 'deportation' or 'forced population transfer,' only 1,032 have been repatriated, despite various diplomatic efforts.

title: US has made 'direct contact' with Syria's victorious HTS
summary: While Blinken and other diplomats held talks on Syria in Aqaba, Jordan, Turkey reopened its embassy in Damascus, nearly a week after the Islamist-led rebels toppled president Bashar al-Assad.

title: South Korea's president impeached after calling martial law
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached on Saturday over his failed martial law bid. Prime Minister Han Duck-soo is now the nation's interim leader.

title: Five dead, dozens missing in Greece as migrant boat sinks
summary: The boat sank 12 nautical miles southwest of the island, according to ERTNEWS, which reported the 40 missing. 39 survivors were rescued, all men.

title: Georgia Parliament elects pro-Russian Mikheil Kavelashvili as president
summary: Known for his anti-Western stance, the 53-year-old former footballer's appointment as president is widely seen as 'illegitimate.' He's set to succeed the pro-European president, Salome Zurabishvili, who refuses to step down.

title: Iranian singer Parastoo Ahmadi faces questioning after performing without a headscarf
summary: The young singer shared a live broadcast of her concert on YouTube, which has been viewed a million times. Some saw it as a gesture of defiance against the Iranian authorities, who immediately launched legal proceedings.

title: Saudi-hosted COP16 ends without reaching agreement to combat drought
summary: For two weeks, the risks to food supply were at the heart of debates at the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification, which failed to achieve the drought protocol called for by Africa.

title: Brazil ex-defense minister arrested in coup plot investigation
summary: A police source said Braga Netto, a close ally of ex-president Jair Bolsonaro, was arrested over an alleged attempt to organize a coup d'état in 2022.

title: Pope Francis's complex relationship with France
summary: One week after the opening ceremonies of Notre-Dame Cathedral, which he chose not to attend, the pope will travel to Corsica for a religious conference. This third trip to the country once again illustrates Francis' paradoxical relationship with France.

title: Villa Medici, the Roman boarding house for young chefs
summary: Since 2022, in addition to artists and researchers, the Académie de France in Rome has welcomed a promising chef in residence. This year, it's Arturo Franzino's turn to imagine the official meals and menus for the cafeteria, where staff, visitors and residents come to eat.

title: Zelensky, Macron and Trump were at the Elysée together. Does anyone care?
summary: In Paris to mark the opening of Notre-Dame de Paris, Emmanuel Macron tried to bring the spirit of peace to the Elysée by welcoming Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: China: Xi Jinping brings finance to heel with arrests and salary caps
summary: The financial sector is under pressure from the Chinese Communist Party to give up its profits and put itself at the service of 'common prosperity.'

title: London's legendary Smithfield meat market to close
summary: Located in the heart of the City and active for over 800 years, it was the last great historic market to resist the sanitization of the city center.

title: ABC News agrees to give $15 million to Trump's presidential library to settle defamation lawsuit
summary: The settlement agreement describes ABC's presidential library payment as a "charitable contribution," with the money earmarked for a non-profit organization that is being established in connection with the yet-to-be built library.

title: South Korea President Yoon Suk Yeol impeached by the National Assembly
summary: After a first failed attempt, the South Korean National Assembly ended the president's term, guilty of having attempted a coup de force by declaring martial law on the night of December 3 to 4.

title: The brutal labyrinth of the American healthcare system
summary: The assassination in early December of Brian Thompson, the head of UnitedHealthcare, the US's leading health insurance company, has rekindled the debate over the way medical care is managed in a system that costs patients dearly.

title: In Niger, 39 villagers killed in a double attack by suspected jihadists near Burkina Faso
summary: The 'barbaric acts' saw 21 people killed in Libiri and 18 in Kokorou, including children, the defense ministry said, and took place from December 12 to 14.

title: Putin and Erdogan, the friends who are foes in Syria
summary: Despite the fall of the Syrian dictator, which weakens Russia and strengthens Turkey, the sometimes friendly, sometimes hostile relationship between the presidents seems unshakeable. Both are critics of the West, and their countries are dependent on each other.

title: Valencia's Albufera nature reserve polluted by tonnes of waste after the devastating floods
summary: The deadly flood that swept through the southern suburbs of Valencia on October 29 washed a great deal of waste into the lake and rice fields of the wetland area, rich in biodiversity.

title: At least 14 killed as Cyclone Chido devastates Mayotte, according to provisional list
summary: France's interior minister will travel to the French territory of Mayotte on Monday, alongside 160 soldiers and firefighters to reinforce.

title: Australia says 'Bali Nine' drug ring prisoners have returned home
summary: The nine Australians were arrested by Indonesian police in 2005 after they were accused of trying to smuggle over eight kilograms of heroin from Bali.

title: Prince Andrew says he has 'ceased all contact' with suspected Chinese spy
summary: A UK court banned the Chinese national, who was Prince Andrew's close confidant and business advisor, from entering the UK for reasons of national security.

title: Pope Francis welcomed in Ajaccio on first-ever  Corsica visit
summary: The 87-year-old pontiff used his address at congress to call for 'a concept of secularity that is not static and fixed, but evolving and dynamic', and urged people to pray for the cylone-hit French Indian Ocean territory of Mayotte.

title: 'For centuries, the Church has denigrated Corsican religiosity, a subtle blend of the sacred and the profane, which the pope is now interested in'
summary: Pope Francis is visiting Ajaccio on December 15 to take part in a symposium on 'popular religiosity.' For the occasion, researcher Angelina Antonetti, who is taking part in the event, describes an abundant, lively and politically-tinged Corsican piety, in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Western leaders worry over risks of fragmentation in Syria
summary: The integrity of the country is threatened by Turkey's next steps, which is pushing further into the north, and Israel, which has occupied a new part of the Golan Heights.

title: Israel to close embassy in Dublin over 'anti-Israeli policies'
summary: Ireland has recognized a Palestinian state and backed an ICC case accusing Israel of 'genocide.'

title: Five killed in shootings near Dunkirk, suspect hands himself in
summary: French authorities said the man, 22, turned himself in after five people were shot dead in northern France.

title: France's new PM Bayrou faces budgetary challenges as Moody's downgrades credit rating
summary: Moody's penalized the country's inability to restore its public accounts. The absence of a budget places the new prime minister in an even more difficult situation than that of his predecessor, Michel Barnier.
